needed.description: Maintainers needed. Familiar with the handling of SGML and XML catalogs? Related packages such as DocBook, DTDs, etc? We need your help maintaining our ports and to help keep abreast of the bugs. Get in touch now!

The PPC team is looking for AT's to help with testing and keeping the stable tree in a decent state. They are also after people to work on java-bugs and testing-requests on ppc. Got a power pc? Got some time? Get in touch!
The media-optical herd is looking for maintainers to help with testing and version bumping of various CD-writing applications and frontends.
The MIPS team is looking to expand the troop, interested soldiers may get in touch with Alex.
The GNUStep herd is desperately looking for maintainers to look after unmaintained packages.
Desperately seeking Susan^WErlang.. er, wait. The Scheme, common lisp and Haskell herds are understaffed. If you have an interest in helping them out, please don't hesitate to get in touch.
Maintainer needed for *TeX, includes supporting tetex-3, and preparing the switch to TeXlive.
The sparc team could use some more people for software testing, keywording and release work. ~sparc and ~sparc64 users are most welcome!
The toolchain development is currently done by 1-3 developers. Some experienced perl-developers needed!
People interested in app-backup, or people who generally want to see the package they use see maintained, can contact Lisa for that. People with tape-devices are most welcome!
This team is looking for a few more hands.
Looking for translators. The list of currently official translators can be found on our internationalisation subproject page. If your language is not listed, please contact GDP for more information.

dev-db/mysql* and many dependancies need a maintainer. Main requirements are knowledge of c++, MySQL internals and database administratation (something more than basics). Francesco is available as a mentor and is able to get you familiar with the current state of things.
To get Gentoo on to ARM CPUs we need developers to undertake package testing, patching and general bug solving.
To get Gentoo working on uClibc systems we need people to help with uClibc debugging, toolchains, developing tools, and generally architecture testing and patching.
To get Gentoo on to S390 CPUs we need developers to undertake package testing, patching and general bug solving.
The Gentoo Security Team is seeking GLSA Coordinators to help with open security bugs that need solving.
To further develop and support Voice over IP applications more developers are wanted.
There are a large number of bugs related to GCC, binutils and glibc that need to be solved.
The Sci team is looking for developers to help out with GIS.
Steve is looking for developers to help out with dev-tools.
The Java team is looking for new developers to help with maintaining Java ebuilds. In particular, Eclipse and related tools, Enterprise Java applications and libraries and gcj need more attention.
The Alpha team is looking for developers with the ability to maintain (bug-fix, test) packages for the Alpha hardware platform. Ideally these developers have access to, or own, Alpha boxes.
The BSD team is looking for developers who have experience with both BSD and with GNU/Linux to help port Gentoo to the FreeBSD platform.
More developers are required to maintain network monitoring tools.

The app-backup herd is looking for developers to work on creating and maintaining ebuilds for backup applications within Gentoo. Experience with tape drives or any backup software (esp. Bacula, Arkeia, Tivoli) considered a major plus, but anybody willing to learn and having reasonable ebuild skills will be considered. A sampling of open bugs for this task are listed here: http://tinyurl.com/8yexl
Gentoo's accessibility project is in need of help with things such as ebuild maintenance, kernel hacking, and LiveCD creation. We're also in need of someone to assist with bug solving.
The GNOME herd needs people who want to help maintain packages and help with bug-solving.
Currently the GNUstep herd consists of one member and is in dire need of additional manpower to help maintain ebuilds and assist in bug squashing.
desktop-misc, desktop-dock and desktop-wm herds need new developers to help with ebuild maintenance, introducing new ebuilds into the tree and general bugfixing.
The net-mail team is looking for someone experienced with courier MTA to help maintain this orphaned packagages.

The Vim herd needs new developers familiar with Vim and its scripts and also the way in which Vim is packaged in Portage. If you meet these requirements, please email recruiters and Cc vim@gentoo.org.
